author: cnbc.com
title: Autodesk reports 4Q loss
text:
SAN RAFAEL, Calif. (AP) _ Autodesk Inc. (ADSK) on Tuesday reported a loss of $173.5 million in its fiscal fourth quarter.
The San Rafael, California-based company said it had a loss of 79 cents per share. Losses, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were 9 cents per share.
The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for a loss of 12 cents per share.
The design software company posted revenue of $553.8 million in the period, also surpassing Street forecasts. Eight analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $545.3 million.
For the year, the company reported that its loss narrowed to $566.9 million, or $2.58 per share. Revenue was reported as $2.06 billion.
For the current quarter ending in May, Autodesk expects its per-share earnings to range from 1 cent to 4 cents.
The company said it expects revenue in the range of $550 million to $560 million for the fiscal first quarter. Analysts surveyed by Zacks had expected revenue of $586.1 million.
Autodesk expects full-year earnings in the range of 77 cents to 95 cents per share, with revenue ranging from $2.46 billion to $2.51 billion.
Autodesk shares have increased 14 percent since the beginning of the year, while the Standard & Poor's 500 index has increased 2 percent. In the final minutes of trading on Tuesday, shares hit $119.87, an increase of 45 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on ADSK at https://www.zacks.com/ap/ADSK
